review_title: I worked at SRHC for quite some time loved my job also had great respect for Management!
pros: Super caring employees that even if they are over-worked they don't give up they keep a positive attitude with their peers and especially the patients!!
cons: High expectations, poor salary increases, not much incentive given to hard working employees!! No matter how negative my personal outcome was with SRHC I still have a lot of respect for every employee including management and would recommend the facility to be a great place to work!

review_title: It's great if you stay below the radar
pros: Co-workers are fabulous.  The care is fantastic!  Team work is excellent.
cons:
- Error reporting is incredibly punative, instead of helping the process it is a search and destroy mission for you and your career.
-If you are looking to find a home where you feel like you make a difference and could possibly move into management this is NOT the place to do it.
-If you are looking for someone to "have your back" this is not the place for you.

pros: newer facility, clean and good co-workers.    Decent benefits, good community
cons:
Little room for advancement 

Facility recently bought up all the clinics making a monopoly on health care within the community and drives down competitiveness of wages.


management  while hiring recently compared nurses to waitresses as this is how she viewed the job.  Stating "don't forget patient satisfaction scores are about perception of the experience"  

Administration is very disconnected from the staff and does not value experience.

8 or 9 to 1  nurse ratios on medical units.

Getting called on most nights off to pick up extra but then hear complaints about overtime from administration
